subject: Physical Fitness
title: Runner's Knee
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Runner's Knee.

hook.text: It's the most common running injury on earth. Pain around or behind the kneecap that worsens with stairs.

buildup.text: Patellofemoral pain syndrome â€” runner's knee â€” affects up to 25% of all runners at some point.

discovery.text: It's not bone grinding on bone. It's typically irritation of tissues around the kneecap from excessive compression.

twist.text: The cause is usually hip weakness, not knee weakness. Weak glutes allow the knee to collapse inward during running.

climax.text: Strengthening the hips and quadriceps resolves most cases. Rest alone often fails because it doesn't fix the cause.

punchline.text: Runner's knee starts at the hip. Strengthen above the pain to fix below.

quiz.question: What is the most common underlying cause of runner's knee?
options: Hip and glute weakness allowing knee collapse
Running shoes that are too tight
